‎10-29-2010 08:29 AM

I am not sure how it would look on a small screen, but if you go to www.nutritiondata.com, you can type in your food, narrow it down, and get a full nutrition label, with both portion size and carb count. So that might meet your needs...
Morris

Diagnosed Type 2, with an A1c of 11.4 in 2003; averaging a 5.0 A1c since then with diet, exercise and Glipizide XL + meds for blood pressure and cholesterol.  A bit dated, but scroll down on this page if you want to know more ...

Looking for a Windows Mobile App for Carb Counting

Options
  • Mark as New
  • Bookmark
  • Subscribe to Direct Replies to This Post
  • Subscribe to RSS Feed
  • Highlight
  • Print
  • Email to a Friend

‎10-29-2010 10:04 AM

Kenneth Eldridge (10/26/2010)
Is anyone familiar with a carb counting app for Windows Mobile? It seems incredible to me that they exist for Palm and iPhone but not Windows Mobile. It would be a tremendous help as I allways carry my phone...but sometimes don't have my Carb Reference Book on my person. Thanks.


Do you have a data plan on your Windows Mobile Phone? If you do you can use Calorie King. I have a Track 3. It is the only app that I know that adjusts for the different weights and weighs in different forms such as oz and grams and will automatically adjust depending on the number of grams or oz one puts in. I know that Nutrition Data does this as well as Calorie King. If you have a data plan on your phone you can access both via the
Internet.

a Deaf person with Diabetes.

‎10-29-2010 03:16 PM

I'm not sure if it's available for Windows, but I downloaded the Android app for SparkPeople. I love being able to track my food to keep track of my carbs. At this time I'm diet and exercise controlled so I need to keep tabs on my carbs. Good luck to you!

-Sue.
SAHM to five wonderful kids. Gestational diabetic x 5
Type 2 - diagnosed 3/24/08. Diet & exercise controlled
Diabetes Ramblings (blog)

‎10-30-2010 08:18 AM

There's an older Carb Counting app available from Atkins. There's a demo version available if you'd like to try it out. It's written for the Pocket PC, but a lot of those apps will run on Windows Mobile as well, it's trial and error though.


http://handheld.softpedia.com/get/Health/Counter/Atkins-Diet-Carb-Counter-Pocket-PC-15783.shtml
